item.title: Senior Press Officer
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to the consolidation of democracy and to support institution building and transparency in Honduras in the context of the implementation of the EU EOM recommendations of 2013.

The specific objectives of the Mission are:

  • to assess and report to the European External Action Service (EEAS) and the European Commission (EC FPI) on the progress made in electoral reforms since the delivery of the final report of the 2013 EU EOM. The findings of the mission will be presented to the European Parliament and Member States. The mission will focus its assessment on the implementation of the recommendations of the 2013 EU EOM and on the aligning of all elements of the electoral process to international standards and relevant national legislation of Honduras.

  • in view of future elections, in particular the 2016 elections, advise on potential EU action(s) contributing to the implementation of the recommendations and/or to the overall improvement of the electoral framework.

The findings of the EFM will constitute an input for the formulation of projects supporting electoral reform and/or strengthening the functioning of electoral bodies, including the Congress. Specific attention could be paid to possible short-term support projects that could be implemented by the EU prior to the next elections in 2016.

Senior Press Officer

Qualifications and Skills:

  • At least Master’s Degree Academic level in Journalism, Communications or Media Studies OR, in absence of the Master’s degree, equivalent professional experience of 15 years in the area related to Lot 7.

General Professional Experience

  • At least 12 years of experience in the area journalism, media or law related to media / media watching.

Specific Professional Experience

  • S/he must have previously been participating in election observation by the EU or other organisations with the participation in at least 3 election observation missions with international or domestic organisations. Those can include: Election Observation Missions (Core Team positions), Election Assessment Team (expert position), Election Expert Mission (expert position), Exploratory Mission (expert position), Needs Assessment Missions (expert position);

  • Familiarity with the legal and regulatory framework for the election as well as international and regional standards for elections;

  • Extensive experience in Media monitoring systems, legislation and methodology, election administration and/or election observation and assistance.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to nicte_garcia-soria@dai.com
